history.content:
Take enough challenging technical classes and get good grades in them. I think the GPA requirement is 3.5 (Edit from another user, the requirement is 3.0) but from what I understand most applicants are expected to have 3.7 or higher. Also find a research advisor who will commit to mentoring you through your masters project and will write a recommendation letter for you. You'll also need two other recommendations (total 3 rec letters)  so be sure to identify people and form a relationship with them. Tutor/TA experience is also probably good (but I know many people who have gotten in without it). 

idk about exact acceptance rate (Again another edit, it's about 80%) but ik that a big part of it is the research advisor has to say yes to you, so be sure you talk to them about it early.

I am thinking about applying for a 5th-year master's program. How should I prepare for it? What are the things I should do to boost my chance to be admitted? Also, I am curious about the acceptance rate. Thank you!
history.subject: How to prepare for 5th year master application
